alert.note: Alert for Del Norte (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:18PM PST until January 14 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in California... Smith River Near Dr Fine Bridge affecting Del Norte County. For the Smith River...including Crescent City, Dr Fine Bridge... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Smith River near Dr Fine Bridge. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Flooding is likely near the gravel plant and on South Bank Road in the vicinity of US Highway 101. Water may flow across low-lying areas into Lake Earl about 4 miles south of the river, including areas along lower Lake Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM PST Saturday the stage was 33.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 33.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM PST Saturday was 35.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 33.9 feet late Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage by Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.9 feet on 03/18/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.Sunday morning at 700 AM PST.
